definition: surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: Outlaws of the marsh the loyalty and patriotism thought is manifests through the different character.
sentences.chinese: 《水滸傳》的忠義思想是通過不同人物體現出來的。

sentences.english: This poem expressed the poet's affection in the cockles of the heart and the loyalism in the poem was sincere.
sentences.chinese: 該詩是詩人自鳴中懷之作，詩中所表忠義確係真心。

sentences.english: The view on loyalty covers a course of evolution.
sentences.chinese: 忠義觀念有一個不斷演變的過程。

sentences.english: Sincere dogs for loyalty, foster care Silly pig though stay provoking pity.
sentences.chinese: 誠犬護院爲忠義，憨豬雖呆惹人憐。

sentences.english: A worthy man like you must be bringing good news.
sentences.chinese: 你是個忠義的人，必是報好信息。

definition: (of knowledge, skill etc) to be passed on from teachers to students, one generation to another, abbr. for 薪盡火傳|薪尽火传[xin1 jin4 huo3 chuan2]
righteousness/virtuous cause/a woman's marriage/main points of a piece of writing
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
lit. when you drink water, think of its source (idiom); gratitude for blessings and their well-spring/Don't forget where your happiness come from./Be grateful for all your blessings!
to dedicate oneself to the service of one's country
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
Xiaoyi county level city in Lüliang 呂梁|吕梁[Lu:3 liang2], Shanxi 山西
surname Zhao/one of the seven states during the Warring States Period (476-220 BC)/the Former Zhao 前趙 (304-329) and Later Zhao 後趙 (319-350), states of the Sixteen Kingdoms
Lord Guan (i.e. 關羽|关羽[Guan1 Yu3])
